Question: ['What precautions should be taken while handling the product?']
Answer: ['Keep away from heat, hot surfaces, sparks, open flames and other ignition sources. No smoking. Keep container tightly closed. Keep cool. Ground and bond container and receiving equipment. Use explosion-proof equipment.']

Question: ['What are the first aid measures in case of inhalation?']
['What are the first aid measures in case of skin contact?']
Answer: ['Rinse skin with water [or shower]. Take off immediately all contaminated clothing.']

Question: ['What are the first aid measures in case of eye contact?']
Answer: ['Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing.']

['How should accidental releases, spill, or leak of the product be handled?']
Answer: ['Clean up in accordance with all applicable regulations. Absorb spillage with non-combustible, absorbent material.']

Question: ['What precautions should be taken for safe handling and storage of the product?']
Answer: ['Keep away from heat, hot surfaces, sparks, open flames and other ignition sources. No smoking. Keep container tightly closed. Keep cool. Ground and bond container and receiving equipment. Use explosion-proof equipment. Use non-sparking tools. Take action to prevent static discharges. Wear protective glove/protective clothing/eye protection/face protection. Store in well-ventilated place']

Question: ['What are the exposure controls and personal protection measures recommended for the product?']
Answer: ['Good industrial hygiene practices requires that exposure be maintained below the TLV. This is preferably achieved through the provision of adequate ventilation. When exposure cannot be adequately controlled in this way, personal respiratory protection should be employed.']
